ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The course was very effective in teaching the German language very good beginning course. It was appropriately challenging without being overly so, as any good language course should be. I am now able to comfortably speak a basic level of German what more can you ask of a Elementary I?
German language skills - speaking, listening, reading, and writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is excellent. The communicative approach is very effective. I think the only thing I would find more helpful would be to punctuate the exercises and classes with some more formal grammar instruction.
You learn more German than you would expect and it's very natural and not too hard.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I highly recommend this course. The workload is definitely doable it is regular enough and distributed evenly enough that it never seems to be too much. I would not say it has a particularly higher workload than other courses; it's about average. It can be a fun course overall, which I haven't heard from many of my peers in some other language departments. Of course I have no way of knowing, but I can say German is a solid choice.
Yes, the course is an excellent introduction to the German language.
I would absolutely recommend this course if you are even the slightest part interested in learning German.
Yes! The course is easy and you learn a lot
